thread.title: Manchester United hand trial to Slovakian teenager Martin Murcko - who had spell at City in December

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Manchester United hand trial to Slovakian teenager Martin Murcko - who had spell at City in December

organizations.name: facebook follow us on twitter manchester united fc newsletter follow @mirrorfootball subscribe

text:
Manchester United hand trial to Slovakian teenager Martin Murcko - who had spell at City in December The 16-year-old, who currently plays in the second tier of Slovakian football, had a trial with City in December Share Comments By Stuart Mathieson 17:11, 28 FEB 2017 Updated 17:12, 28 FEB 2017 Sport United boss Jose Mourinho (Photo: AFP) Share Comments Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email Manchester United have handed a trial to Slovakian teenager Martin Murcko.
The 16-year-old, who currently plays in the second tier of Slovakian football, had a trial with Manchester City in December.
He has come to the Reds attention after excelling at the Under-17 European Championships, reports the Manchester Evening News.
Murcko has scored four goals in his opening three appearances for his country's under-17s, including a hat trick in a 4-3 qualifying win against Northern Ireland.
Murcko has visited United's Carrington training complex this week where he published a picture of himself with United's newly-won EFL Cup.
United recently appointed a new Polish scout to secure up and coming Eastern European talent.
It is all part of Academy chief Nicky Butt's revamp of United's production line.
This week they have also signed Welsh attacking midfielder-cum-forward Levente Gundogan from Connah's Quay Nomads after the 14-year-old completed a successful six week trial.
